result.heading: A SUDDEN CLUSTER OF MEN AND MACHINES,
MAN FALLS OUT OF THE SKY,

direction.raw_text: .    THE SAHARA DESERT.    DAY. SILENCE.  THE DESERT seen from the air.  An ocean of dunes  for mile after mile.  The late sun turns the sand every color from crimson to black. An old AEROPLANE is flying over the Sahara.  Its shadow swims over the contours of sand. A woman's voice begins to sing unaccompanied on the track.  Szerelem, szerelem, she cries, in a haunting lament for her loved one. INSIDE the aeroplane are two figures.  One,  A WOMAN, seems to be asleep.  Her pale head rests against the side of the cockpit.  THE PILOT, a man, wears goggles and a leather helmet.  He is singing, too, but we can't hear him or the plane or anything save the singer's plaintive voice. The plane shudders over a ridge.  Beneath it A SUDDEN CLUSTER OF MEN AND MACHINES, camouflage nets draped over the sprawl of gasoline tanks and armored vehicles.  An OFFICER, GERMAN, focuses his field glasses. The glasses pick out the MARKINGS on the plane.  They are English.  An ANTI-AIRCRAFT GUN swivels furiously. Shocking bursts of GUNFIRE.  Explosions rock the plane, which lurches violently.  THE WOMAN SLUMPS FORWARD, slamming her head against the instruments.  The pilot grabs her, pulls her back, but she's not conscious.  The fuel tank above their heads is punctured.  It sprays them both, then EXPLODES. THE MAN FALLS OUT OF THE SKY, clinging to his dead lover.  The are both ON FIRE.  She is wrapped in a parachute silk and it burns fiercely.  He looks up to see the flames licking at his own parachute as it carries them slowly to earth.  Even his helmet is on fire, but the man makes no sound as the flames erase all that matters - his name, his past, his face, his lover... 2
direction.name: direction

result.heading: PILOT HAS BEEN RESCUED BY BEDOUIN TRIBESMEN

direction.raw_text: .    1942.    DAY. THE PILOT HAS BEEN RESCUED BY BEDOUIN TRIBESMEN.  Behind them the wreckage of the plane, still smoking, the Arabs picking over it.  A SILVER THIMBLE glints in the sun, is retrieved.  Another man comes across A LARGE LEATHER-BOUND BOOK and takes it over to the Pilot.  The Pilot is charred.  His helmet has melted into his head.  He's oblivious to this, cares only about the woman who crashed with him.  He twists frantically to find her.  Two men pick him up and carry him across to a litter where they carefully wrap him in blankets. 3
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. The Pilot is being carried across the desert.  A mask covers his face. His view of the world is through the slats of reed.  He glimpses camels, fierce low sun, the men who carry him. 4
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. The Pilot sees a man squat down beside him, takes a date from a sack and begin to chew it.  Carefully, the Bedouin eases the mask from the Pilot's face, leaving bandages of cloth and oil, but revealing a mouth. He stops chewing and passes the pulped date into the Pilot's mouth. Mouth to mouth. 4a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAWN. THE CARAVANSERAI CROSSES THE DESERT, silhouetted against the dunes. 5
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. The SOUND OF GLASS, of tiny chimes.  A music of glass. AN ARAB HEAD APPEARS ON A MOVING TABLE IN THE DESERT.  It floats in darkness, shimmering from the light of a fire.  The image develops to reveal a man carrying a giant wooden yoke from which hang DOZENS OF SMALL GLASS BOTTLES, on different lengths of string and wire.  He could be an angel. The man approaches the litter which carries the Pilot.  He's still in the protective reed mask, wrapped in blankets.  The MERCHANT DOCTOR stands over the burned body and sinks sticks either side of him deep into the sand, then moves away, free of the yoke, which balances in the support of the two crutches.  He puts some liquid in the Pilot's tongue, whose eyes almost instantly begin to roll.  Then he slowly sets about peeling away the layers of oiled cloth which protect the Pilot's flesh. The Merchant Doctor crouches in front of the curtain of bottles and MAKES A SKIN CUP with the soles of his feet, then leans back to pluck, hardly looking, certain bottles, which he uncorks and mixes in the bowl he'd made with his feet.  This mixture he uses to anoint the burned skin.  Next he finds green-black PASTE - ground Peacock Bone - and BEGINS TO RUB IT on to the Pilot's rib cage.  All the while he us humming and chanting.  The bottles continue to jingle. 6*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EARLY 1945.    DAY. The sand gives way to trees, the jingling bottles to distant church bells, as A CONVOY OF TWENTY TRUCKS - Red Cross vehicles and some supply vehicles - snakes along a bumpy hill road.  The war in Italy is largely over and the Allies are moving up the country, the wounded and supply lines slowly following. 7*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. A young CANADIAN NURSE, HANA, sits in a truck full of patients.  Hana pays special care to the PATIENT lying in the stretcher alongside her. This is the PILOT - now known as THE ENGLISH PATIENT.  A web of scars covers the Patient's face and body.  They have the quality of a livid tattoo, magenta and green-black.  The hair has largely gone and the effect is curious, lassoing his features, the strong nose, the eyes liquid.  It's a warrior's face.  But he has no physical strength.  He coughs violently as the trucks shudders along the road. 8*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. A JEEP pulls out of the line and approaches the Red Cross truck containing Hana and the Patient.  The horn blows and Hana looks out to see it contains her best friend, JAN.  TWO YOUNG SOLDIERS sit up front, one driving, both grinning.  Jan signals for Hana's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's meant to be lace in the next village - the boys are taking me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sewing anything else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have any money, do you? Just in case there's silk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hana, I know you do! Hana leans under the tarpaulin, holding some DOLLARS.  The two hands - hers and Jan's - reach for each other as the vehicles bump along side by side.  They laugh at the effort.  Jan's GOLD BRACELET catches the sun and glints.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sewing anything else for you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you. The Jeep accelerates away.  Hana sighs to the patient. Suddenly AN EXPLOSION shatters the calm as the jeep runs over a MINE. The jeep is THROWN into the air.  The convoy halts and there's chaos as soldiers run back pulling people out of the vehicles.  Hana runs the other way, towards the accident, until she is prevented from passing by a soldier. 9*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    LATER. -- and there's still chaos as two SAPPERS arrive on motorcycles.  One of them, a SIKH, wears a turban. The motorcycles arrive at the front of the convoy.  A nurse, MARY, is helping a doctor, OLIVER, attend to the injured driver.  The other two bodies are covered with blankets.  There's blood everywhere.  The Sikh and his colleague pull out the paraphernalia of their bomb disposal equipment. 10
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. KIP, the Sikh Lieutenant, and HARDY, his sergeant, explore the road ahead of the becalmed convoy, using saucer-like METAL DETECTORS and HEADSETS.  Kip is young, lithe, contained, utterly focused as they inch along the debris-strewn road.  He stiffens as he registers metal.  With a bayonet he carefully scrapes at the mud-caked surface.  Something GLEAMS.  Suddenly, A PAIR OF FEET walks across his vision as HANA HURRIES PAST, walking carelessly up the road.  It's so surreal that neither man registers at first, and then Kip is shouting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Hey!  Stop!  Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't move!  Stand ABSOLUTELY STILL! Hana stops.  Hardy gingerly follows her footsteps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, that's good, just stay still for me and then we're going to be fine. He arrives at Hana.  Then grabs her.  He'd like to slap her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?!  What the bloody hell do you think you're doing? By way of an answer she looks at the ground ahead of her feet.  Jan's BRACELET lies in the mud.  Hardy bends down and collects the mangled bracelet, presses it into Hana's hands. 11
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. The CONVOY is threading through A RUINED VILLAGE, passing the souvenirs of war.  An overturned vehicle now used as a game by some children, dejected refugees tramping along the side of the road.  From the end of one of the buildings are hanging HALF A DOZEN CORPSES, strung upside down with crude placards denouncing, in Italian, their collaboration with the Nazis. 12
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    CONTINUOUS. Hana sees all this as she sits blankly inside the truck, the Patient swaying alongside her.  She puts out her hand to steady him. 13*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. THE CONVOY is making a PITSTOP.  The trucks are silhouetted in a line. Hana helps lift the Patient's stretcher onto the ground.  She bends to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you need something? The Patient nods.  Hana gets up to prepare MORPHINE INJECTION from a small kit.  Mary arrives.  Touches Hana gently, conscious of her grief for Jan's death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you okay?  Oh God, Hana, you were like sisters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We keep moving him - in and out of the truck.  Why?  He's dying.  What's the point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we can't hardly leave him.  Do you mean leave him?  We can't. Hana has settled down beside the Patient's stretcher.  She draws herself up against the night.  On the hill above, she can see the outline of A SMALL MONASTERY in the moonlight.  She's crying, her face a frozen mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I must be a curse.  Anybody who loves me, anybody who gets close to me - or I must be cursed.  Which is it? The Patient laces her fingers into his crabbed hand. 14
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana is investigating the MONASTERY OF ST. ANNA, wandering through its overgrown gardens, past a pond.  What sanctuary it seems to offer. 15*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana explores via a gaping hole in a LIBRARY where the walls have collapsed from shelling.  The garden intrudes, ivy curls around the shelves.  Bloated books lie abandoned, and there's a PIANO tiled up on one side.  Hana presses the keys through the filthy tarpaulin which covers it.  Everywhere there are signs of a brief German occupation. 15a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Past the Library is a CLOISTERS, drenched with silver light. 15b*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana goes upstairs, negotiating a huge VOID in the stone treads two thirds of the way up. 15c*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. She comes across a small CHAPEL, with the remains of murals and an altar pressed into service by the Germans as a table.  Hana finds an old bed, and a mattress. 16
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE HANDLELESS PUMP IS SUDDENLY GUSHING,

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana comes out, passes a DRY WATER TROUGH.  She hears a rustling on the gravel and turns to see A TORTOISE ambling towards the trough.  On cue there's A GURGLING SOUND.  THE HANDLELESS PUMP IS SUDDENLY GUSHING, splashing water everywhere.  The Tortoise, clearly arriving for this, enjoys a welcome shower.  Hana goes to the trough, dips her hands into the water.  Looks around her, and makes a decision. 17
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    ITALY.    DAY. The Convoy is in the final stages of loading up.  Oliver passes the vehicles, deep in dispute with a determined Hana, who is carrying some sacks of rice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The war's over - you told me yourself. How can it be desertion?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not over everywhere.  I didn't mean literally.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When he dies I'll catch up. Oliver hovers as Hana adds the rice to a small cache of provisions, then lays another blanket over the Patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not safe here.  The whole country's crawling with Bandits and Germans and God knows what.  It's madness.  I can't allow it. You're not, this is natural - it's shock. For all of us.  Hana -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need morphine.  A lot.  And a pistol.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what if he really is a spy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He can't even move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If anything happened to you I'd never forgive myself. Hana nods.  A tiny smile.  Oliver shrugs helplessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're heading for Leghorn.  Livorno the Italians call it.  We'll expect you. 18*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. TWO SOLDIERS are helping Mary and Hana carry the Patient into the monastery.  Hana indicates the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up there. They struggle up the stairs, one of the Soldiers gasping as he narrowly avoids falling into the void in the stairs.  The cot almost tips up, at which the Patient SUDDENLY SPEAKS, his voice cracked and rasping, but still clearly aristocratic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a Prince, who was dying, and he was carried up the tower at Pisa so he could die with a view of the Tuscan Hills. Am I that Prince? Hana laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're leaning?  No, you're just on an angle.  You're too heavy! Mary laughs.  They reach the landing.  Hana kicks open the door to the CHAPEL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In here. 18a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana lets Mary take the weight while she goes to the bed and pulls away the drapes, sending up a cloud of dust.  They lower the Patient onto the bed.  She turns to the SOLDIERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. She shuts the door on them, leaving Mary staring aghast at the room, its faded frescoes, its mold, its chaos.  Hana smiles, opens a shutter to let a fierce envelope of light into the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. She goes to Mary and hugs her. 19*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THROUGH THE DAMAGED FLOOR OF HER ROOM SHE HAS A VIEW OF THE PATIENT BELOW HER
NOW SHE HAS SCISSORS AND STARTS TO CUT OFF HER HAIR, NOT AGGRESSIVELY, BUT IN A GESTURE OF A NEW BEGINNING

direction.raw_text: .    THE MONASTERY.    DAY. A smaller upstairs room completely bare.  As Hana tugs off her uniform, she looks out of the window to see the departing Convoy.  A cotton dress goes on over her head and she emerges looking suddenly younger and rather fragile.   THROUGH THE DAMAGED FLOOR OF HER ROOM SHE HAS A VIEW OF THE PATIENT BELOW HER.  SHE LOOKS AT HIM.  NOW SHE HAS SCISSORS AND STARTS TO CUT OFF HER HAIR, NOT AGGRESSIVELY, BUT IN A GESTURE OF A NEW BEGINNING. 19a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. HANA walks down to the Patient's Room and stands in the doorway.  The Patient turns his head to her.  He's grinning.  He puts up a thumb.  On the track a song begins:  Some Other Time. 20*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  1938.  LATE DAY. THE SONG CONTINUED IN THE DESERT where we find the singer - PETER MADOX, a weather-beaten man who is working on the guts of an BATTERED TIGER MOTH AEROPLANE.  His face is blackened with oil.  A second European, ALMASY, stands beside him, holding tools and a section of the camshaft.  Madox yanks out a perished rubber hose and holds it up for Almasy to inspect.  Behind them is an ENCAMPMENT - some camels foraging in the meager scrub, half a dozen black tents of the BEDOUIN: guides and servants to the Almasy/Madox Expedition.  It's 1938 and the whole continent is full of such expeditions, competing with each other, pursuing lost treasures, sources of rivers, hidden cities. D'AGOSTINO, the team's Italian ARCHEOLOGIST, drives towards the plane in one of the expedition's adapted FORD MOTORCARS.  He gets out carrying a large earthenware WATER JAR.  He looks very pleased with himself as he shows the jar to Almasy and then passes it to Madox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thirsty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't drink it! He reaches for the jug, then pours out a little sludge - it's a brackish and stinks.  Madox makes a face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't guarantee the vintage, my friends.  I just dug it out of the hill. Madox and Almasy have seen many such jugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent.  That's terrific, D'Ag. (to Almasy, of a tool) Toss that up, would you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are some others. 21
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BASE OF A HILL SEEMS COMPOSED ENTIRELY OF POTTERY JARS

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. THE BASE OF A HILL SEEMS COMPOSED ENTIRELY OF POTTERY JARS. D'Agostino emerges over the brow of a dune, leading Madox and Almasy. The other members of the team are already there - BERMANN, a German PHOTOGRAPHER and FOUAD, EGYPTOLOGIST from Cairo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, look at this! They bend to touch the jars, literally hundreds of them, mostly broken, piled on top of each other.  Bermann approaches them, carrying his tripod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Incredible, Hmm?  Quite incredible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never seen anything like it.  There would have been enough water here to serve an army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which means we're in the wrong place. Almasy speaks with a slight but unmistakable European accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you stockpile water near to an Oasis?  There can't be a natural spring within fifty miles of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or they didn't know of one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, it may not be Zerzura, still incredible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pottery hill!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wild goose chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Almasy gives him a look.  But Madox will have none of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  Now we look in the other places. We're eliminating. The unmistakable buzz of AN AEROPLANE distracts them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good, and here comes reinforcements. 21a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. LATER and a smart new aeroplane, a STEERMAN, makes a smooth landing on the flat desert.  The expedition team drives over to meet the arrivals. Almasy is not with them.  He's walking, apparently not so enthusiastic. A young, kissed and newly-married couple emerge from the plane.  They are GEOFFREY AND KATHARINE CLIFTON. And it's immediately clear that Katharine is the woman in the plane- crash at the beginning of the film. Madox makes all the introductions.  Hands are shaken, hellos all round, as the couple disembark in their leather flying gear.  Geoffrey removes his helmet and, in what we will come to know as an ubiquitous gesture, produces a bottle of CHAMPAGNE and sets off the cork with a flourish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hereby Christen us the International Sand Club! 22
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    LATE DAY. The party is in the shade of the tents.  Almasy joins the group.  Madox nods over to the Clifton plane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Marvelous plane.  Did you look?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't it?  Wedding present from Katharine's parents.  I'm calling it Rupert Bear.  Hello.  Geoffrey Clifton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can finally consign my old bird to the scrapheap. Almasy smiles and walks on towards the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Clifton - Count Almasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geoffrey gave me your monograph when I was reading up on the desert. Very impressive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanted to meet a man who could write such a long paper with so few adjectives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A thing is still a thing no matter what you place in front of it.  Big car, slow car, chauffeur-driven car, still a car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A broken car?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still a car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much use, though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love?  Romantic love, platonic love, filial love - ?  Quite different things, surely?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uxoriousness - that's my favorite kind of love.  Excessive love of one's wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you have me. 23
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  THE MONASTERY.  MORNING. The morning floods into the room.  The Patient lies, lost in the desert.  Then a sudden CLATTERING NOISE disturbs him. 24
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   DAY. Hana is dropping armfuls of books into the cavities of the damaged stairs, and with others, she is improvising new steps.  The heavy volumes are perfect for treading on. 25
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   DAY. Hana comes in, gathers up another armful of books and carries them out to continue her stair repairs. 26*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was all the banging?  Were you fighting rats or the entire German army?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was repairing the stairs.  I found a library and the books were very useful. Hana shrugs.  She's attending to him, pulling back the sheets, plumping up the pillows.  He's short of breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before you find too many uses for these books would you read some to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think they're all in Italian, but I'll look, yes.  What about your own book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My book?  The Herodotus?  Yes, we can read him. Hana picks up the book and hands it to him.  Then she starts rummaging in her pockets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh - I've found plums.  We have plums in the orchard.  We have an orchard! She has peeled a plum and now slips it into his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. His mouth works with the pleasure of the taste, a little juice escaping from the mouth.  Hana mops it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plumness of this plum. A noise, GURGLING sound, disturbs them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? 27
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    THE MONASTERY.    DAY. Hana comes through the Cloisters into the garden as the gurgling increases.  She's in time to catch the TORTOISE arriving once again in the WATER TROUGH just as it starts to gush with water.  She shouts up to The Patient's open window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Water! (bends to the Tortois) You hear it, too, don't you! 28
direction.name: direction

result.heading: PAPERS, PHOTOGRAPHS, HAND-DRAWN MAPS AND SKETCHES

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Close on the HERODOTUS.  The Patient opens its cover, held together by leather ties.  Loose PAPERS, PHOTOGRAPHS, HAND-DRAWN MAPS AND SKETCHES are all collected between the pages.  He claws at some water-colors which appear to be based on CAVE PAINTINGS - figures, dark-skinned warriors of the stone age, some with bows in their hands, others with plumes in their hair - arranged in abstract patterns uncannily like those of Matisse.  Some appear to be swimming, another is diving.  Then the Patient loses control of the papers and the whole parcel SPILLS to the floor with a crack. 29
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. A SHOT RINGS OUT, disturbing the evening meal.  Almasy and others go outside.  Silhouetted on a ridge, a group of men sit astride camels. One of them holds his rifle aloft, clearly pointing towards the sky - means friend.  Fouad peers at the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: European, I think, with guides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, and I think I know who this is. 30
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AND MADOX WALK OUT TO INTERCEPT THE ARRIVALS

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. ALMASY AND MADOX WALK OUT TO INTERCEPT THE ARRIVALS as the first Arab dismounts, the procession of camels splaying out as if in collapse. Almasy speaks in Arabic, exchanging the ritual greetings. DURING THIS, FENELON-BARNES, sole European in this expedition, has finally persuaded his camel to sit, and dismounts irritably, slapping the animal in disgust.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ugly brute.  Shits and roars and complains all day. (bypassing Almasy and approaching Madox) Of course, you have your aeroplane. Two now!  Do you still call yourselves explorers?  I assume not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fenelon-Barnes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I think a sailor can call himself an explorer, can't he?  Or should Columbus have swum to America? 31
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. The arrivals come inside.  Madox handles the introductions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you know all of us, except for Geoffrey and Katharine Clifton, who've recently come out from England.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Apprentices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Clive Fenelon-Barnes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know your mother, of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm also searching for the lost Oasis, but by more authentic means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anyway, my friend here has a new theory - that Zerzura doesn't exist.  So we may all be chasing windmills.  Have some food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's certainly not between here and Dakhla.  Nine days of nothing but sand and sandstorms.  An egg.  I found an ostrich egg and some fossils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't Zerzura supposed to be protected by spirits who take on the shape of sandstorms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of fossils?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll invite you to my paper at the Royal Geographical Society. Are you still a member? He takes a long drink from a bowl of frothing camel milk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you know I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quite impossible, Madox.  You must know that.  If you attempt to cross the Sand Sea due east of Kufra by car you'll leave your bones in the sand for me to collect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you come across my bones - I hope you'll do me the honor of leaving them in peace. (to Katharine) Excuse me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have my word as a gentleman. (watching him leave) I've discovered a unique type of sand-dune.  I've applied to the King for permission to call it The Fenelon-Barnes Formation. 32
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (he sips) Look - my lungs are useless - (makes a small gap with his fingers) I've got this much lung...the rest of my organs are packing up - what could it possibly matter if I were Tutankhamun?  I'm a bit of toast, my friend - butter me and slip a poached egg on top. Hana leaves, smiling at the Patient's irascibility, sharing this with the Officer, who frowns.  The interview continues. 57
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CONVALESCENCE HOSPITAL HAS BEEN FASHIONED FROM A LONG ROW OF BATHING CABINS ON THE COAST,

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana walks between the cabins.  STUART steps out of the shade.  He is drawn, older than last seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My leave is canceled.  I can't meet you later. Hana frowns, helpless.  As if to emphasize this, a Staff Nurse comes by, carrying a bowl and a withering look. 58*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana enters, approaches the Patient.  She's circumspect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask - my friend, can he come in? Just for a few minutes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your friend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's going back to the front this evening.  I can't see him otherwise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just go off.  I'll be quite all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I can't go, but if it, if you weren't offended, it would be very good of you to allow us - every other cabin is crammed. This is as private as we'll get.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then - yes.  Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  Thank you. She hurries out, returns with Stuart.  They stand awkwardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Captain McGann.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, don't waste your time on pleasantries -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to sing.  If I sing I shan't hear anything. And with that he bursts into a raucous, coughing version of Yes! We Have No Bananas.  He changes language each verse.  The couple stand, formal, then edge round to the back of the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got a mustache.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bit of one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was looking forward to this evening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had a hotel room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought that was for when we were very very old?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm feeling old. They EMBRACE, fiercely, hardly making a sound, or moving.  THE PATIENT ROARS THE SONG. 59*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   HANA'S GARDEN.   MORNING. A battered open backed TRUCK comes into the Monastery.  An ITALIAN PARTISAN sits in the back, a SHOTGUN resting on his knees.  The truck stops, and Caravaggio emerges from the passenger door.  He collects some packages from the PARTISAN, including a dead RABBIT, and then exchanges a few words with the driver.  Hana, who's watching all of this from her garden, sees that the driver is a WOMAN.  The woman's name is GIOIA, and Caravaggio leans into the window to make his goodbye to her. Caravaggio approaches the Vegetable Garden as Hana comes to greet him. He throws her the rabbit, and hurries up the stairs without pausing, clutching the other boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Supper. Hana calls after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where've you been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rabbit hunting. Hana looks at the rabbit.  She's angry.  Caravaggio hasn't been around for a week. 60*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  DOWNSTAIRS CORRIDOR.  DAY. Hana heads up for the kitchen, then stops as there's a faint CRASH from upstairs. 61*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   UPSTAIRS CORRIDOR.   DAY. Hana, the rabbit still in her hands, comes along the corridor to find Caravaggio SLUMPED on the floor, retching.  The discarded NEEDLE lies beside him, the new package of MORPHINE CAPSULES ripped open.  He looks up at Hanna, glazed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could help you.  I could get you off that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you cook the rabbit or will you try and bring that back to life? She bends, starts clearing up, putting the morphine phials back into the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a week.  We didn't know where you were - or if you coming back, or -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should be happy.  What were you going to do for him when it ran out? He pulls out more phials from his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you do?  What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some gave me a dress. (starts to tear at a parcel) You know what's great?  What I'm learning? You win a war and you not only gain the miles you get the moral ground. Everywhere I go, we're in the right. I like that. 62*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana comes in, carrying a batch of the new morphine.  She's wearing a different FROCK.  It's not new, and it's faded, but the change of color is startling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something smells so rich.  My stomach is heaving -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He came back, he says he caught a rabbit.  I'm cooking it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a different dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He keeps asking me questions about you. Do you know him?  Do you recognize him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do I recognize him?  I recognize what he is. I like him.  He's Canadian.  He can read Italian.  He can catch rabbits. 63*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. Almasy squats with an ANCIENT ARAB outside his rudimentary house, while he draws on the sand, talking in some arcane dialect, scratching out a possible location for the lost oasis.  The man stops speaking and scours the sky a beat or two before we or Almasy hear the faint noise of a PLANE.  It's Clifton's Steerman, Rupert Bear, coming in to land. Almasy doesn't look up. The Arab continues to talk.  The newly-arrived Katharine has scrambled up the hill to speak to Almasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello.  Not to interrupt but we're celebrating. She makes to leave but Almasy puts up a hand to keep Katharine there, but quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is an incredible story - about a man hunting an Ostrich, he's been telling me about Zerzura, he thinks he's been there, but his map, the route he's describing, he couldn't survive the journey now, but he's a poet, so his map is poetry - and now we're onto an Ostrich. (to the Arab in ARABIC) I'm telling her your map is poetry. The Arab shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, poetry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mountain curved like a woman's back, a plateau the shape of an ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds perfectly clear.  Where does the Ostrich come in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Ostrich is a detour.  A poor man hunts an ostrich, it's the method.  Nothing to do with Zerzura.  To catch an ostrich you must appear not to move.  The man finds a place where the ostrich feeds, a wadi, and stands where the ostrich can see him, on the horizon, and doesn't move, doesn't eat - otherwise the ostrich will run.  At nightfall, he moves, fifty, sixty yards.  When the ostrich comes the next day, the man is there, but he's nearer. (to the guide) Haunting the ostrich. The Guide speaks, amplifying something, picking at his robe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, the ostrich, it will feed a family, not just the meat, but by selling the feathers, beak, the skin, a year from this one animal.  So, each day the man gets closer.  And the ostrich is not sure - has something changed? - now the standing man is only a few yards from where it feeds.  And then one day, the man is in the wadi, in the water.  And the Ostrich comes, as always, dips into the water and the man JUMPS UP - and captures it. He shrugs.  The Arab has more to say.  Almasy doesn't respond, quieting him with a dismissive gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is he saying? (Almasy, awkward, shakes his head) Come on, what did he say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said - be careful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be careful?  You mean you - or me?  Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her or me? The Arab speaks again.  Almasy speaks without looking at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one who appears not to be moving. 64*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   BASECAMP AT POTTERY HILL.   NIGHT. Katharine comes in.  Then, a beat, and Almasy.  Clifton is holding up the champagne. CLIFTON Gentlemen, to Zerzura.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zerzura.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a special thank you to Geoffrey and Katharine, without whose fund-raising heroics we should still be kicking our heels. They toast the Cliftons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To arm-twisting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did Katharine say? - Geoffrey has to fly back to Cairo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have to return the favor - take a few photographs for the army.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darling, Peter says I could stay...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What kind of photographs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Portraits.  The Brigadier, the Brigadier's wife, the Brigadier's dogs, the Brigadier at the Pyramids, the Brigadier breathing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you think?  About my staying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well look, if nobody minds, truly, then I suppose - I shall, of course, be bereft...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But finally able to explore the Cairo night-life.  I shall produce an authoritative guide to the Zinc Bars and - I want to say Harems - am I in the right country for Harems? 65*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    MORNING. As Clifton prepares to leave in the Steerman, Almasy approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Safe journey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too.  Good luck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifton - your wife - do you think it's appropriate to leave her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Appropriate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think the desert is, it's - for a woman - it's very tough, I wonder if it's not too much for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you mad?  Katharine loves it here. She told me yesterday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the same, I, were I you I would be concerned -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've known Katharine since she was three, my aunt is her aunt, we were practically brother and sister before we were man and wife.  I think I'd know what is and what isn't too much for her.  I think she's know herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you people so threatened by a woman?! He settles into the controls.  Almasy watches the plane taxi away. Doesn't move at all.  Katharine waves from the tent as the Steerman takes off. 65a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The THREE FORD CARS leave the campsite, loaded for a scouting expedition.  The rest of the party, Bedouin, tents, camels and Tiger Moth is left behind.  Madox shouts last-minute instructions from the window of his car. 66*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A SMALL CLOUD OF DUST EMERGES OVER A RIDGE

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. FENELON-BARNES sits astride his camel, and wipes away the sweat.  The desert stretches for miles, shimmering, the sun baking the sand.  His GUIDES wind their headcloths tighter.  Nobody speaks.  Then one of them looks round, raises a hand.  A BUZZING noise.  They all turn.  A SMALL CLOUD OF DUST EMERGES OVER A RIDGE.  Locusts?  A sandstorm? A CARAVAN OF CARS, the Almasy/Madox expedition, bumps along, suspensions threatened by the constant dips and ridges.  On each car there are three in the passenger cabin, the open backs crammed with drums of gasoline and water and equipment.  On the front vehicle, the tenth member of the party, KAMAL, acts as a navigator and sits on a CAMEL SADDLE, a rodeo cowboy, on the roof of the leading car, driven by Madox.  As they spot FENELON-BARNES they sound their horns and wave good-naturedly.  F-B scowls, watches them roar by, stealing his thunder. 66a*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: DESERT EN ROUTE TO CAVE OF SWIMMERS

result.heading: OF THE CARS IS HOPELESSLY BOGGED DOWN IN HEAVY SAND

direction.raw_text: .   DAY. ONE OF THE CARS IS HOPELESSLY BOGGED DOWN IN HEAVY SAND.  It's contents have been unloaded, and a rope ladder is being inserted under the tires.  The entire company huff and puff and argue about the best means of extricating the vehicle. 67*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: DESERT EN ROUTE TO CAVE OF SWIMMERS

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. LATER - Almasy drives the second car, accompanied by Katharine and Al Auf.  Katharine breaks the long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been thinking about - how does somebody like you decide to come to the desert?  What is it?  You're doing whatever you're doing - in your castle, or wherever it is you live, and one day, you say, I have to go to the desert - or what? Almasy doesn't answer.  Katharine, who has looked at him for an answer, looks away.  There's another long silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I once traveled with a terrific guide, who was taking me to Faya.  He didn't speak for nine hours.  At the end of it he pointed at the horizon and said - Faya!  That was a good day! Point made, they lapse again into silence.  Katharine boils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, you sing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sing.  All the time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask Al Auf. Almasy asks Al Auf in Arabic.  He laughs, nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be down to get you in the taxi, honey, you'd better be ready about half-past eight...! Al Auf nods and grins furiously, joins in, impersonating Almasy. Almasy grunts in irritation. 68*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: CAR EN ROUTE TO CAVE OF SWIMMERS

result.heading: A NEW AND TEMPORARY BASE CAMP

direction.raw_text: .  DUSK. The group is investigating a cleft in the rocky massif.  They climb slowly.  Below them, A NEW AND TEMPORARY BASE CAMP. The group winds around the rock.  Almasy turns to offer a hand to Katharine behind him, pulling her up to the next rock slab.  She smiles at him.  He smiles back curtly, continues. The group stops at a level plateau.  The Arabs stand apart and SING THEIR PRAYERS AT DUSK.  Al Auf leads the incantations.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allahu Akbar, Allahu Akbar... The westerners wait respectfully.  As the sun sets in glory, Almasy looks over at the range of rocks.  One particular range seems to look exactly like A WOMAN'S BACK.  He squints at the rock.  Almasy discreetly pulls out his COMPASS. 69*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: NEAR THE BASECAMP AT THE CAVE OF SWIMMERS

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. Almasy clambers up the rocks, coming through a narrow crevice to find A NATURAL SHELF.  He scrambles up this path, reaching up, only to notice that his hand almost perfectly covers A PAINTED HAND on the rock, and as he digests this he realizes he has climbed past what is THE MOUTH OF A CAVE.  He disappears inside. 70
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    FLASHLIGHT. A FLASHLIGHT squirts into the cave.  Almasy treads cautiously along the narrow winding passage.  He comes to an open cavern and takes his flashlight up to a wall.  PAINTINGS EMERGE, figures, animals,  ancient pictures.  A giraffe.  Cattle.  Fish.  Men with bows and arrows. Almasy is astonished by what he sees. 71*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EVENING. The others watch as a flashlight bobs and jerks among the rocks as Almasy comes scrambling down, transformed into an excited teenager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madox!  Madox! He slithers in a heap in front of the astonished expedition party. Doesn't care. 72
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    FLASHLIGHT. Almasy has led the whole party into the heart of the cave.  Now Madox comes alongside him at the wall, his flashlight joining Almasy's and increasing the visibility of the paintings.  A dark-skinned figure, apparently in the process of DIVING into water, comes clearly into view.  Then others supine, arms outstretched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My God, they're swimming! The others crowd round.  FIVE EXCITED FACES IN THE GREEN GLOOM OF THE CAVE. 73*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: FIVE EXCITED FACES IN THE GREEN GLOOM OF THE CAVE

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. A hive of activity.  The team has set up TRESTLES to catalogue the finds as the Bedouin come out with baskets of detritus, which they empty onto a growing heap as the Cave is cleared out.  Entering the cave, Almasy passes with camera equipment, just as D'Ag emerges carrying the corpse of a perfectly preserved DESERT FOX.  D'Ag gestures to Almasy with his customary enthusiasm, holding up the body of the fox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you seen this?  Astonishing. Perfectly preserved. 74
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Inside, Bermann is setting up LAMPS, running wires from a car BATTERY. Kamal is helping him.  And as Almasy arrives he catches a tiny moment of tenderness between them.  Bermann, seeing him, quickly disengages and busies himself with the lights.  At another wall, Katharine is catching. 75
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. The CARS are heading back to Basecamp.  They bounce over the sand. 76*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Bermann is driving the lead CAR along some STEEP DUNES.  Almasy beside him.  Bermann is peeling AN ORANGE, a segment of which he holds out of the window.  Kamal, riding shotgun, leans down and collects it, his head dipping in to grin at Bermann.  Bermann looks uneasily as Almasy. He wants to tell him of his passion, of his absolute love for Kamal, but he daren't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love the desert, you see.  That's my, that's my - I can't think of the word. (Almasy nods) How do you explain?  To someone who's never been here?  Feelings which seem quite normal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, my friend.  I don't know. Bermann holds out another segment of the orange, and watches the slim brown hand collect it.  A MOMENTARY DISTRACTION IS ALL IT TAKES FOR HIM TO MISJUDGE THE LINE AND SUDDENLY THE DUNE COLLAPSES UNDER THE TIRE AND THE CAR LURCHES SIDEWAYS AND TOPPLES OVER THE EDGE.  D'Ag - following, Fouad beside him - brakes sharply, but can't stop his own car from being caught in the avalanche of sand, and IT PLUNGES DOWN THE DUNE AND INTO BERMANN'S UPTURNED CAR WITH AN OMINOUS CRUNCH, the radiator exploding.  Only Madox, Katharine beside him, and a little way behind, manages to stay clear of the trouble.  He jumps out of the vehicle and slides down the dune to find pandemonium as the passengers stumble out of the cars, sand flying, smoke pouring from the upright vehicle, the wheels of the overturned car spinning wildly in the air, a puddle of oil spreading ominously. 77*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A MOMENTARY DISTRACTION IS ALL IT TAKES FOR HIM TO MISJUDGE THE LINE AND SUDDENLY THE DUNE COLLAPSES UNDER THE TIRE AND THE CAR LURCHES SIDEWAYS AND TOPPLES OVER THE EDGE
IT PLUNGES DOWN THE DUNE AND INTO BERMANN'S UPTURNED CAR WITH AN OMINOUS CRUNCH,

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. LATER and the group have cleaned up as best as possible.  D'Ag, Bermann, and Fouad are a little worse for wear.  Fouad's arm is in a sling, and D'Ag is sporting a bloody head-bandage.  Bermann has broken a finger and is being attended to by Madox.  The luggage, water and petrol have been stacked up and the men are loading up the remaining car.  Almasy is working at the crumpled end of the vehicle.  He's having no success. 78*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Almasy, Kamal and two of the other young Bedouin stand around the mess of the two broken vehicles.  The ONE WORKING CAR is loaded with men and provisions.  Katharine sits inside, next to Madox, Almasy comes over to her window, to speak past her to Madox.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be back as quick as I can. Thirty-six hours at the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try to get a second radiator, we'll bury it between here and the Pottery Hill. And a better jack.  We planned badly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bermann! This is Bermann's cue to take leave of Kamal who is staying behind. Kamal makes a little bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May God make safety your companion. Bermann nods and hurries away, squeezing into the car which jolts off, bouncing over the track. THE VEHICLE GETS ABOUT TWENTY YARDS, ALMASY WATCHING, BEFORE IT SINKS FORLORNLY INTO THE SOFT SAND.  IT'S HOPELESSLY OVERLOADED WITH PEOPLE. THEY ALL GET OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shall stay behind, of course
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I insist.  There clearly isn't room for us all, I'm the least able to dig, and I'm not one of the walking wounded. Those are facts.  Besides, if I remain it's the most effective method of persuading my husband to abandon whatever he's doing and rescue us. It's hard to argue with this logic.  Almasy shrugs. LATER - THE MADOX CAR makes a more effective departure.  And Almasy and Katharine are left alone.  THEY LOOK AT EACH OTHER as if realizing this for the first time.  Almasy immediately returns to the two damaged vehicles and helps the men stretch the cut canvas which was once a tent TO FASHION A MAKESHIFT SHELTER BETWEEN THE TWO CARS.  Katharine goes to join them.  There is no obstacle to the remorseless horizon, just miles of undulating dunes. 79
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (nods at Almasy, then shouts over to the wrecked vehicles)
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: VEHICLE GETS ABOUT TWENTY YARDS, ALMASY WATCHING, BEFORE IT SINKS FORLORNLY INTO THE SOFT SAND
TO FASHION A MAKESHIFT SHELTER BETWEEN THE TWO CARS

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Almasy sits alone, writing into HIS HERODOTUS, a map folded in front of him, from which he makes notes.  Katherine comes across with a clutch of her SKETCHES from the Cave wall.  Hands them to him.  They're beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you might paste them into your book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We took several photographs, there's no need.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd like you to have them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's really no need.  This is just a scrapbook.  I should feel obliged.  Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that would be unconscionable, I suppose, to feel any obligation? Yes.  Of course it would. She's already turning, walking as far from him as the cramped shelter permits.  He continues with his maps. 80
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE DEEP TRACKS OF MADOX'S CAR STRETCHING OFF TOWARDS CIVILIZATION

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Katharine sits alone on top of the Dune, smoking, surveying the landscape.  Below her the makeshift camp - a fresh wind flicking at the tarpaulin, THE DEEP TRACKS OF MADOX'S CAR STRETCHING OFF TOWARDS CIVILIZATION.  Almasy emerges from the tent and, locating Katharine, heads towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should come into the shelter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm quite all right, thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look over there. Katharine turns, scans the horizon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I looking at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See what's happening to them - the stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're so untidy.  I'm just trying to rearrange them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In an hour there will be no stars. The air is filling with sand. He offers a hand.  A little reluctantly she takes it. 81
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. The team hurries around the improvised tent, weighing it down with packing cases, gasoline drums, water cans, bringing anything loose or light inside the tarpaulin.  THE WIND is whipping up, the air busy with sand.  Almasy pushes everyone under cover. 82
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SAND SEEMS TO BE SCOURING THE TARPAULIN

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. THE SAND SEEMS TO BE SCOURING THE TARPAULIN.  Kamal and Almasy try to secure one vulnerable area, but suddenly there are leaks everywhere and the sand swarms inside. It's noisy, too, and Almasy has to shout to make himself understood, indicating to the Bedouin to grab water and blankets and food, all the valuables, and get out.  He himself finds blankets and water and shouts at Katharine to do the same.  One side of the canvas suddenly RIPS apart like paper. Chaos as figures struggle in ever-worsening conditions, sand blizzarding the air. 83
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. THE SHELTER FLIES INTO THE AIR, stranding the figures, their heads wrapped in blankets, flashlights useless.  They seek safety in two groups, the tribesmen to the cabin of the overturned car, Katharine and Almasy to the upright one. 84
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Inside the cabin, the sand swirling around them, Katharine and Almasy sit without speaking.  Dawn is trying to break through.  He pours a little water into a mug so that they can wash out their eyes and noses and mouths.  She takes her silk scarf and first dries her eyes with it, then dries his.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is not very good, is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we be all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes is a comfort.  Absolutely is not. 85
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAWN. The sand is piling up against the two cars, the tent is swept from its moorings, the water cans are hurled up too, and then plunge ominously into sand drifts as if going under an ocean.
direction.name: direction
