result.heading: THE TRAIL OF SHELL LAMPS CONTINUES,

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. In the Cloisters THE TRAIL OF SHELL LAMPS CONTINUES, like tiny cat's eyes.  As they reach the hopscotch chalk marks, they outline the squares.  Hana HOPSCOTCHES and then follows the light, disappearing round a corner. 158
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Hana comes through into the stables.  The lamps lead her, then they stop.  She peers into the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hana. She turns to the voice.  He steps out of the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip. And he goes to her. 159
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EARLY MORNING. Hardy knocks cautiously on the door of the stables.  Eventually Hana opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was looking for the Lieutenant Singh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's sleeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only we have to go to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll tell him.  What is it?  Is it a mine?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bomb.  At the Viaduct. She closes the door, then reappears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he have to go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pardon me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if you couldn't find him...? (Hardy's bewildered) Sergeant, not today, please. Not this morning. Kip comes to the door, winding his turban.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening?  Am I needed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid so, sir. Kip hurries to his tent.  Hana follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't go.  I'm frightened.  I can love a coward, I can't love another dead man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what I do.  I do this every day. And he's ready, Hardy having wheeled out their motorcycles.  He gets on his, and they're away, Hana hardly able to look. 160
direction.name: direction

result.heading: IS LOWERED BY A PULLEY INTO THE SHAFT THE SAPPERS HAVE MADE AROUND THE BOMB

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. KIP IS LOWERED BY A PULLEY INTO THE SHAFT THE SAPPERS HAVE MADE AROUND THE BOMB.  Hardy supervises.  The bombs huge - 2, 000 lbs, and protrudes ostrich-like from the pit, its nose sunk into a pool of sludge at the base of the viaduct. Kip steps off and sinks knee deep in mud, grunting in disgust. Warily, he touches his huge opponent, feeling the condition of the case.  He wipes the metal.  Reveals a serial number, calls it out to Hardy, who's perched on the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serial number - KK-1P2600. He's hypnotized by the number: KK-1P: a bomb with his name on it. 161
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: A VIADUCT NORTH OF THE MONASTERY

direction.raw_text: .   DAY. Hana cycles along on Caravaggio's bicycle.  A TANK comes roaring up behind her, then a second and a third, loaded up with people, citizens and soldiers, and children, waving flags and gesticulating.  She lets the metal circus go by. 162
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Back in the shaft, Kip works away, his fingers shaking with the cold from the oxygen he's using to freeze the fuse.  Suddenly there's a VIOLENT TREMOR.  The ground is SHUDDERING, and the bomb slips horribly. Kip GRABS AT IT helplessly as if trying to stop a man from falling, instead it falls on him pushing him into the sludge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardy!  Hardy!  What's happening?! 163
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. The TANKS are rumbling towards the Viaduct.  HORNS start sounding. HARDY, below, bellows at his men above for explanation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Corporal!?  Dade!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tanks, sir.  Don't know what it's about. God only knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this - a bloody carnival? Stop them! Three Sappers run across the bridge towards the oncoming procession. They wave their orange flags, the tanks wave back wit their flags - Stars and Stripes, Union Jacks.  Now SHOTS are ringing out.  In the shaft, oblivious, Kip slides out from under the bomb, the oxygen spurting everywhere, all over his clothes, hissing on the surface of the water.  Hardy bends into the shaft, heedless of his own safety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got to cut, sir, that frost won't last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yessir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is making me incredibly angry. He rubs his hands to warm them up, locates his needle pliers and slips them through the tiny gap.  His hand touches the casing and the freeze BURNS his hand.  He jerks back, DROPPING THE PLIERS into the sludge, cursing. Now he's on his hands and knees in the sludge, trying frantically to find the pliers.  Hardy looks at his watch, he can't help.  The seconds run out as Kip grovels in the mud.  Totally submerged, he suddenly comes out with the pliers, goes straight to the fuse, no finesse, and cuts.  There's a snip.  Then nothing.  Then Kip laughs at Hardy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kiss me. Hardy is already at the winch, hauling it up.  Kip can hardly clip on the halter - his hands numb and burned.  As the pulley jerks he just clings on, rising from the grip of the mud like an ancient corpse out of a bog. The other sappers have gathered around the edge of the site.  Great elation on their faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a blanket! (not getting attention) Dade!  Get the Lieutenant a blanket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over, Sarge.  It's over.  Jerry's surrendered. (to Kip) Sir, congratulations! Kip shakes his hand.  Kip shakes Hardy's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Congratulations. And now they're all shaking hands, and slapping backs and the SOLDIERS FROM THE TANKS are there and the victory  celebrations begin.  Kip's blank, drained, not taking anything in, as Dade wraps a blanket around his shoulders. HANA'S ON TOP OF THE VIADUCT, watching as Kip is wrapped in his blanket, the men celebrating.  She shouts with relief from the top of the bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip! 164
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The gramophone plays Frank Sinatra.  Kip sits in the window, the shutters open, the village lit up behind his head, nodding to the music, sucking out of his condensed milk.  Elsewhere there is an open bottle of cognac, some wine.  The Patient has a beaker of wine. Caravaggio is dancing with Hana.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip - come and dance with me
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Later. Caravaggio swirls past the Patient - nodding at the cognac.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've had a drink.  Fatal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, anything you do is likely to be fatal, so you know -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very true! 165
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EQUESTRIAN STATUE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FOUNTAIN

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. A tiny PIAZZA where the Sappers and the Villagers are having their own, more raucous, Victory Feste.  There are accordions, there's dancing, and there's HARDY, stripped to some exotic underpants, a large tattoo: DORIS inside a heart, clambering up the EQUESTRIAN STATUE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FOUNTAIN.  He's astride the horse and now straining to get up to the tip of the outstretched sword, so that he can hang the UNION JACK FLAG he has in his mouth. BLACKLER, one of the Sappers, is Hardy's assistant.  He's drunk and slips from his ladder, falling flat on his back into the fountain with a great splash, to much hilarity. 166        INT.    THE PATIENT'S ROOM.    NIGHT. Hana and Caravaggio are still dancing.  The music has stopped. Caravaggio changes the record.  Hana goes to Kip for a second, beaming, before Caravaggio has snatched her away again.  The Patient taps along to the music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows the Bosphorus Hug?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never heard of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a dance we invented at the International Sand Club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?  You and Madox?  Or you and Katharine Clifton?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? There's a muddled thud in the distance, Kip's ears prick up.  He glances for an instant out of the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that? She is spinning with Caravaggio.  When she comes round again, Kip has gone. 167
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    ITALY 1945.    NIGHT. Kip's motorbike skids into the tiny PIAZZA. A MILITARY AMBULANCE IS ALREADY THERE.  Dade and SPALDING are presiding as the paramedics take two bodies into the rear of the truck.  The shattered fountain, the sluiced flagstones, shining wet and slick, give some clues as to what's happened, as do the elderly standing in the shadows, the distressed girls, arm in arm.  ONE GIRL, young and quite striking, is particularly inconsolable, her grief sobbed out at the doors of the ambulance. SPALDING salutes Kip, who waves his salute away, just wanting to know what happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Booby trap.  They was running up the Union Jack, sir, up off that statue - It just went off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should have been me.  It was my idea but Sergeant Hardy climbed up, sir, him and Blackler. Kip goes to the ambulance.  Spalding tries to stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir - you don't want to look. Kip steps into the back of the ambulance, bends over both bodies, does look, then comes out, past the weeping girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His fiancee, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hardy's?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kept it a bit dark. 168
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    APPROACHING DAWN. Kip has pulled out all of Hardy's gear.  Now he starts on the tent. Hana comes out into the step.  Kip turns, his eyes brimming, sees her, sighs, then turns back and kicks at the pegs, collapsing the tent. Now he's trying to fold a shirt.  Hana takes it from him.  She folds it.  Then together they start to fold the tent, Kip orchestrating, not wanting to talk.  Finally, Kip looks at Hana, stiff with emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking yesterday - yesterday! - the Patient, Hardy: they're everything that's good about England. I couldn't even say what that was. We didn't exchange two personal words, and we've been together through some terrible things, some - (incredulous) he was engaged to a girl in the village! - I mean - (looks at Hana) and us - he never once... He didn't ask me if I could spin the ball at cricket or the kamasutra or - I don't even know what I'm talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You loved him. 169*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EVENING. Caravaggio, reading Dante aloud in Italian, smoking, walks over to the window, looks out. 169*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EVENING. Hana is approaching Kip's tent, carrying a light.  She ducks inside the tent and the light disappears. 169b*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EVENING. Caravaggio turns back into the room, towards the Patient, still reading. 170
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Hana lies over Kip, unraveling his turban, slowly, sensual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If one night I didn't come to the tent, what would you do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I try not to expect you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if it got late and I hadn't shown up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'd think there must be a reason.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't come to find me? (Kip shrugs) That makes me never want to come here. But she continues unraveling the turban.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I tell myself he spends all day searching, in the night he wants to be found. 171*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  1939.  DAY. The Expedition Team is packing up the Basecamp.  Madox and Almasy are loading things into the plane.  FOUAD, AL AUF and others work at the cars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Had a letter from my wife.  The wisteria is still out, which I'm looking forward to.  She says Dorset is gripped with Invasion Fever.  Wrong coast I should have thought, still...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bermann thinks he'll be interned, poor fellow.  I'm going to do what I can, but...  And D'Ag turns out to be a great admirer of Mussolini. So now you can say I told you so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We didn't care about countries. Did we?  Brits, Arabs, Hungarians, Germans.  None of that mattered, did it?  It was something finer than that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  It was.  Thanks for the compass. I'll look after it for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When's Clifton picking you up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow afternoon.  Don't worry. I'll be ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll leave the plane in the hangar at Kufra Oasis.  So if you need it...hard to know how long one's talking about.  We might all be back in a month or two. Madox kneels and takes A HANDFUL OF SAND, puts it into his pocket.  He throws his haversack into the plane then turns.  Almasy puts out a hand.  This is a moment of great emotional weight for them both, conducted as if nothing were happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to teach myself not to read too much into everything.  Comes of too long having to read so much into hardly anything at all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, my friend. They shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May God make safety your companion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is no God. (smiles) But I hope someone looks after you. Madox clambers into his plane, then remembers something, jabs at his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In case you're still wondering - this is called the supasternal notch. Almasy nods, goes to the propeller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come and visit us in Dorset.  When all this nonsense is over. (then shrugs) You'll never come to Dorset. The plane roars into life.  Almasy watches it taxi away - then heads back to continue with his packing up. 172*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: BASECAMP AT THE CAVE OF SWIMMERS

result.heading: SHOOTS HIMSELF BEHIND THE ALTAR IN THE ROOM

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. MADOX SHOOTS HIMSELF BEHIND THE ALTAR IN THE ROOM.  The Patient's stertorous breathing, each intake accompanied by a small noise, a note, suddenly stops.  Then steadies again.  He appears to be alone. 173
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Kip is in the tent, looking out of the flap, waiting for Hana. 174*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Kip walks in looking for Hana. 174a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Kip enters, sees Hana is not with the Patient, hears his uneven breathing, then goes out.  From the shadows of the room, CARAVAGGIO shifts position.   He's slumped on the floor, staring at the man prone in the bed. 174b*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Into her bedroom, Kip can't find her there either.  He turns to go, walking down the wooden stairs, until her voice stops him in his tracks.  She's in the shadows of the eaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes I need you to find me. 175*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .     NIGHT. The Patient's eyes open to see Caravaggio at the morphine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hana tells me you're leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are going to be trials, they want me to interpret, don't they know I'm allergic to courtrooms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We shall miss you. He delivers the injection.  The Patient sighs.  Caravaggio takes off his jacket.  A pistol is stuck in his waistband.  The Patient sees it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, I come across the Hospital Convoy (holds up the syringe) I was looking for this stuff, and some nurse, Mary, Hana's friend, tells me about you and Hana, hiding in a monastery, in purdah, whatever it is - retreat - (he administers his own injection, using his teeth grip the sleeve) how you'd come in from the Desert and you were burned and you didn't know your name but you knew the words to every song there was and you had one possession - (picks it up) #NAME? full of letters and cuttings, and then I knew it must be you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd seen you writing in that book. At the Embassy in Cairo, when I had thumbs and you had a face. And a name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before you went over to the Germans, before you got Rommel's spy across the desert and inside British headquarters. He took some pretty good photographs - I saw mine in that torture room in Tobruk, so they made an impression. THE PATIENT And you thought you'd come and settle the score?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You were the only man who knew the desert well enough, the only man who would cross seventeen hundred miles of nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to get back to the desert. I made a promise.  The rest meant nothing to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rest meant nothing to me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a result to what you did. It wasn't just another expedition. (holds up hands) It did this.  If the British hadn't unearthed your nosey photographer in Cairo thousands of people could have died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thousands of people did die, just different people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you were among the British, they were your friends - why betray them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what you thought?  That I betrayed the British?  The British betrayed me.  The British betrayed me. 176*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   1939.   DAY. Almasy sits on a ridge transferring map of information from his Herodotus onto a sheet of paper.  He looks up at the sound of Clifton's approaching Steerman.  He folds up the map and sticks it inside one of Clifton's CHAMPAGNE BOTTLES and lodges it between the rocks. 176a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Clifton is flying the STEERMAN up to Gilf Kebir.  From the air it's possible to make out Almasy scrambling down from the ridge towards where the stones indicate a landing area, carrying the last of the materials from the Cave of Swimmers.  Almasy waves in recognition and welcome. 177
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE PLANE SMASHES AGAINST AN INVISIBLE RIDGE AND TURNS OVER AND OVER,
KATHARINE, STARING GRIMLY AHEAD, UNABLE TO MOVE

direction.raw_text: .   DAY. Almasy watches as the plane drops towards him, shielding his eyes against the sun.  the plane bounces along the runway, not quite landing.  Almasy continues packing the equipment. Almasy looks up to see the plane swerve, now suddenly HEADING STRAIGHT TOWARDS HIM.  He's completely vulnerable, nowhere to run.  He dives at the ground.  THE PLANE SMASHES AGAINST AN INVISIBLE RIDGE AND TURNS OVER AND OVER, the wings snapping off like twigs as it hurtles past the prostrate Almasy.  He gets to his feet and starts to run towards the wreckage. A blue line of smoke is uncoiling from the plane, but no fire.  Almasy pulls away the debris to find  GEOFFREY - SLUMPED, NECK BROKEN, BLOODY. He tries to move him, and in the process reveals, to his ABSOLUTE horror, KATHARINE, STARING GRIMLY AHEAD, UNABLE TO MOVE.  He's frantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Katharine!  Oh dear God, Katharine - what are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't move.  I can't get out. Almasy starts to pull at the wreck around her. DURING THIS -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did he bring you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A surprise, he said. Almasy inspects Clifton, tries to find a pulse.  The smoke circles around them.  Katharine looks at her husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor Geoffrey.  He knew.  He must have known all the time.  He was shouting - I love you, Katharine, I love you so much.  Is he badly hurt? His neck is odd. Almasy puts his arm around Katharine to try and pull her clear.  She can't stand the pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't move me.  It hurts too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to get you out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It hurts too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, darling, I'm sorry. The smoke thickens.  He pulls - hard - the pain from which causes Katharine to gasp, then pass out.  They slip haphazardly to the ground, cushioned a little by the sand.  He lifts her gently into his arms and carries her from the danger of the place, then turns and runs back. THE PLANE SUDDENLY ERUPTS IN FLAMES.  Almasy dashes into the fire, disappearing into the smoke before emerging with Clifton over his shoulder, fireman's-lift style. 178
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: BASECAMP AT THE CAVE OF SWIMMERS

result.heading: THE PLANE SUDDENLY ERUPTS IN FLAMES
WRAPPED KATHARINE IN THE SILK FOLDS OF HER PARACHUTE

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. He has WRAPPED KATHARINE IN THE SILK FOLDS OF HER PARACHUTE and emerges from the near the familiar cleft in the rock, struggling with the exertion of the climb as they approach the Cave of Swimmers.  He has a large water bottle slung around his neck and a haversack, and is loaded like a pack horse.  Katharine opens her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you hate me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you know you drove everybody mad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't talk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You speak so many bloody languages and you never want to talk. They stagger on.  He suddenly notices a stain of gold at her neck. It's saffron, leaking from a silver THIMBLE which hangs from a black ribbon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're wearing the thimble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.  You idiot.  I always wear it. I've always worn it.  I've always loved you. Almasy CRIES as he walks - huge sobs, no words - convulsed with the pain of it.  They approach the Cave. 179*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Almasy comes through in shadows, carrying Katharine, blocking out the light that pours into the entrance of the cave.  Once inside, he sets her down incredibly gently, makes a bed of blankets and the parachute. He turns on his flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so cold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.  I'm sorry.  I'll make a fire. I'll be back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't leave me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just going to find things for the fire. 179a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    TORCHLIGHT. Almasy returns with the stocks of ACACIA TWIGS the Expedition had cached.  As he makes the fire, the light sends his shadow flitting across the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shall we be all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.  Absolutely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me, Katharine.  You've broken your ankle and I'm going to have to try and bind it.  I think your wrist might be broken, too - and some ribs, which is why it's hurting you to breathe.  I'm going to have to walk to El Taj.  Given all the traffic in the desert these days I should bump into one army or another before I reach there - or Fenelon-Barnes and his camel.  And then I'll be back and we'll be fine, and I'll never leave you. The fire is lit and he comes over to her, kneels beside her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you promise?  I wouldn't want to die here.  I wouldn't want to die in the desert. I've always had a rather elaborate funeral in mind, with particular hymns.  Very English.  And I know exactly where I want to be buried.  In our garden.  Where I grew up.  With a view of the sea.  So promise me you'll come back for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise I'll come back.  I promise I'll never leave you.  And there's plenty of water and food.  You can have a party. He kisses her tenderly.  Pulls out his HERODOTUS and lays it beside her.  Then he puts down the FLASHLIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And a good read. (of the flashlight battery) Don't waste it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. (clouds over) Will you bury Geoffrey?  I know he's dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, Katharine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every night I cut out my heart but in the morning it was full again. He's tearing strips from the parachute with his knife.  As he starts to bind her wrist he gets her to talk, trying to distract her from the pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me about your garden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our Garden, our garden - not so much the garden, but the copse alongside it, wild, a secret way plunging down to the shore and then nothing but water between you and France.  The Devil's Chimney it was called - (he pulls tight on the binding) The Devil's Chimney, I don't know why. (he kisses her) Darling.  My darling. 180
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DUSK. ALMASY BURYING CLIFTON.  He's dug a narrow trench, and now he goes to the body.  Clifton's face is oil stained, bloody.  Almasy takes his handkerchief and, pouring his precious water into it, CLEANS GEOFFREY'S FACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seventy miles, north - north west. I had Madox's compass.  A man can walk in the desert as fast as a camel. That's about two and a half miles an hour. 181
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. Alamos's walking.  He slides and collapses as he misjudges a dune, gets up, stumbles on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I stopped at noon and at twilight. Three days there, I told her, then three hours back by jeep.  Don't go anywhere.  I'll be back. 182
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAWN. He trudges on, his eyes opening and closing.  He's singing to keep awake.  Darktown Strutter's Ball. - I'll be down to get you in the taxi, honey...  He does a little shuffle.  Looks behind at the crazy trail of his footprints. 182a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAWN. A vast flat expanse of dried salt lake.  A remorseless horizon.  Almasy walks, checking the compass, squinting at the sun.  then he sees a cloud of dust traveling across the horizon.  It comes closer moving at great speed, reveals itself.  An OSTRICH. 183
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Almasy lowers himself by an old rope down into a gully.  He approaches a pile of stones and removes them to reveal a brackish pool of filthy water.  He drinks, pouring water over his head, grimacing at the taste, but parched too. 184*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Almasy gets his first sight of the fortress town of EL TAJ and sinks to his knees, in relief and exhaustion.  Then he gets up and trudges towards the town.  A CORPORAL with a rifle in his hands appears. 184a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. The Corporal brings Almasy into a square.  A young OFFICER appears from the shadows of his office.  His JEEP is parked in the shade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good morning!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could I trouble you for some water?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, of course. (the Corporal has a water bottle, hands it to Almasy) So, golly, where have you come from?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I desperately need a jeep.  There's been an accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I'm not thinking clearly - I need a doctor too, to come with me, can I take this vehicle?  I'll pay, of course - and some morphine and... (calculating) Seventy miles - I can be back here by dusk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you have your papers, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I could just see some identification.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I not talking sense? -  forgive me, I'm, I've been walking, I've - there's a woman badly injured at Gilf Kebir, in the Cave of Swimmers.  I am a member of the Royal Geographical Society.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right.  And what's your name, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Count Laszlo de Almasy. The Officer is writing this down.  A glance at his Corporal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Almasy - would you mind just spelling that for me?  What nationality would that be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, listen to me.  A woman is dying - my wife! - is dying seventy miles from here.  I have been walking for three days!  I don't want to spell my name, I want you to give me this jeep!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I understand you are agitated - perhaps you would like to sit down while I radio back to HQ -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!  NO!  Don't radio anybody, just give me the fucking jeep! Almasy sets on the Officer, hauling him by the lapels, but them immediately loses his balance.  As he stumbles up he gets the stock of the Corporal's RIFLE across his head, KNOCKING HIM TO THE GROUND. 185*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Almasy, head pounding, is in the back of the jeep, chained to the tailgate.  He's desperate.  The Corporal is driving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  Hey!  Stop this jeep!  Let me out of here - there's a woman dying, there's a woman dying while I'm - Hey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut-up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please - I beg you, I beg you, I beg you, please listen to me, this is a terrible mistake.  Just stop, please, and listen to me.  My wife is dying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Fritz, if I have to listen to another word from you I'll give you a fucking good hiding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fritz?  What are you talking about? Who's Fritz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's your name innit?  Count Fucking Arsehole Von Bismarck? What's that supposed to be then, Irish? Almasy, berserk, starts to yank at his chains, screaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me out, let me out, let me out - Katharine!  Katharine! 186
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    TORCHLIGHT. Katharine has been writing in the Herodotus.  The torchlight FLICKERS. She shakes the torch.   It FLICKERS again.  Then goes out.  Absolute BLACKNESS.  The sound of her trembling breath. 187*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    THE DESERT.    DUSK. A TRAIN scuttles through the desert. 187a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    THE DESERT.    DUSK. Almasy is HANDCUFFED to the metal grille of the goods compartment. He's lying down amongst a bunch of other prisoners and their little bundles of possessions in this makeshift cell - some Arabs, some Italians. A SERGEANT pushes a lavatory-bound prisoner along the corridor, leaving behind A YOUNG PRIVATE who sits on a packing case, with a rifle across his lap, reading a Penguin edition of Gulliver's Travels.  Almasy is in complete despair to be on the train.  He tries to move, but he's locked tight to the grille.  He rattles the cuffs against the metal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. (the Soldier looks up) I also need to use the lavatory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll have to wait. (calls up the corridor) Sarge!  Jerry wants to use the lav - says it's urgent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are we going, please?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the coast.  Benghazi.  Soon be there. Get a boat home.  You'll be all right. ALMASY CAN'T BEAR THIS NEWS.  The SERGEANT returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cramps.  It's urgent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on then - you take him. 188
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    THE DESERT.    DAY. The Soldier pushes Almasy along the corridor.  They arrive outside the lavatory.  The Soldier is distracted for a split second.  Enough for Almasy to ELBOW HIM savagely in the stomach, winding him, then he KICKS HIM REPEATEDLY in the head.  He wraps his cuffs around the Soldier's neck and - yanking them together and twisting - produces a tiny, efficient and sickening snap. He finds the KEY to the handcuffs, unlocks them, grabs the soldier and drags him into the empty lavatory. 189
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    THE DESERT.    EVENING. Almasy arrives at the rear of the train, passes the Kitchen carriage, where Arabs sweat over the boiler.  He pulls open the back door only to surprise a GUARD, who's lolling casually, enjoying the sunset.  Almasy SHOOTS HIM with his stole rifle.  He clambers over the guard rail and leaps off the train - tumbling into the desert sunset. 190
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    THE DESERT.    EVENING. Almasy, silhouetted against the evening sky, walks back down the track, THREE HUNDRED MILES AWAY from the dying Katharine Clifton, no way now of saving her.  He is a tiny speck in the vast desert.  His heart broken.  He sinks to his knees in despair. 191*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    NIGHT. The Patient is exhausted.  He has said aloud what has tortured him. His failure to save Katharine.  He looks at Caravaggio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So yes.  She died because of me. Because I loved her.  Because I had the wrong name. 192
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Kip is working at a BLACKSMITH'S FORGE in the Stables.  He is heating pieces of metal.  He has arranged his material on a bench - a bayonet, a rifle, a piece of bomb casting. Hana enters, goes up, hugs him from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you up to?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That gun at Lahor, Kipling's cannon - Zamzammah - remember?  That was made out of the metal of ordinary things. I want to make an ordinary thing out of guns. His bayonet is thrust into the forge.  It's red hot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I went to England I was amazed at what went on, the waste - I'd been taught to re-use everything, the dung from a cow to cool a radiator, a fork to fix a typewriter - India could live for a hundred years on what I saw thrown away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I should go to the house, get breakfast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lamp was burning all night in his room.  Caravaggio was there with him. She goes to kiss him.   He is over the fire and protests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is hot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nya-nya-nya! 193*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Caravagio is injecting the Patient with morphine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And did you never see Katharine?  You never got back to the Cave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I got back there finally to keep my promise.  To come back for her. And then of course I couldn't... I couldn't even do that properly. 194
direction.name: direction

result.heading: METAL GLOWS A VIVID RED ON THE ANVIL

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Kip hammers the metal into its new shape.  He stops, distracted by something he's listening to on his crystal set.  It's new he seems not to fully understand, about a bomb dropping on Japan.  A NEW KIND OF BOMB. THE METAL GLOWS A VIVID RED ON THE ANVIL. Suddenly Kip slops it into the trough of water, sending a great hissing column of steam. 195*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Caravaggio sits by the Patient.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You get to the morning and the poison leaks away, doesn't it? Black nights, fucking black nights, when you want to howl like a dog. I thought I would kill you.  You killed my friends, you ruined my hands.  But the girl was always here, like some Guardian Angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't kill me.  I died years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, now I can't kill you. Kip storms into the room, walks straight up to the Patient and POINTS A GUN AT HIM.  Caravaggio is taken by surprise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip - what are - ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay out of this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I looked up to you, Uncle.  My brother always said I was a fool.  Never trust the British, he said: the deal-makers, the map-makers; never shake hands with them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What have I been doing all this time? Do you know how many mines I've seen? - more mines than there are soldiers, more - how many mines we've put in the ground ourselves, stuffed in corpses, dropped out of the sky.  And now this. He approaches the bed.  Caravaggio tries to intervene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip, listen - Kip sings the rifle at him, KNOCKING HIM to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said keep out of this! He pulls of his earphones and rams them around the Patient's head, dropping the set onto the bed.  The Patient listens, coughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you hear?  Can you hear what they're celebrating?  I listened to you, Uncle. Sitting at your feet - always sitting at somebody's feet - trying to learn.  The right way to hold a teacup, otherwise you're out, the pukkah knot in your tie - as if everything can be explained in terms of a cricket bat and an accent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip! - it's not even my name because you can't say it.  Kirpal Singh Bhuller is my name. Hana runs in, alerted by the commotion, stunned by what she sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, then ask him his name!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happened?  Kip!  What's happening? Don't shoot, please, don't shoot anybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're excited!  They're happy about destroying a whole city.  Would they do that to a White Man's City?  Never!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on, do it.  I don't need to hear any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip, listen, he lost everything because he wasn't English - Jesus! - shoot me, I'm more English than he is! Kip levels the gun at the Patient.  Then breaks it open, throws it down on the bed, next to the earphones, from which the news continues to leak, some words audible - Eunola Gay... Hiroshima... and from different voices - It was beautiful!  just beautiful!  Bang! the biggest bang you ever saw! 196
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (getting in between Kip and the Patient)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .    LATE DAY. Hana approaches.  Kip is inside the tent, the flap zipped.  She sees his shadow move, then freeze as she calls his name.  It's like a confessional.  The flap between them, the man in shadows, Hana crouched, forlorn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip.  Kip.  It's me. (no response) Why?  It's another bomb.  However big, what's the difference?  There've been so many bombs.  What about Coventry?  What about Dresden? Where were those cities? (no response) I don't understand.  Let me come in. The shadow doesn't move.  Hana is at a loss. 197
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EVENING. The Patient becomes aware of something in the room, opens his eyes, squints into the darkness and sees A FIGURE hovering against the wall. He's in the Cave, he thinks, he's seeing the painted figures moving, he's seeing the Swimmer. KIP - bare chested, no turban, hair loose - stands in the shadows at the foot of the Patient's bed. 198
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    EVENING. Kip comes into the room.  Hana sits in the corner.  She is nervous of him, his look, his intensity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you come with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.  When?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean home.  India.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kip... I -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know - here I am always a brown man, there you would be always a white woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that what you think?  Is that what you think I think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's what I've learned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm thinking about your heart, not your skin.  And how to reach it.  And that I don't think I can.  A bomb has ruined us, just not the bomb I thought would ruin us. She stands, goes to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've clung to you.  I've clung to you. Kip.  Life  a raft. KIP (clinging to her) Then come with me. 199
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Next morning and Kip has attached what he was making in the forge - A NEW HANDLE - to the pump.  Now he works it, producing a steady stream of water.  His motorbike is against the wall.  He goes to it. Caravaggio is watching.  He hugs Kip, wrapping his arms around the boy like a bear. 199a*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. HANA stands by her Vegetable Garden.  Kip stops the motorbike.  She goes to him, stands, FASTENS THE TOP BUTTON of his coat.  You feel she might jump on the seat behind him.  But she doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll always go back to that church. Look at my painting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll always go back to that church.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So one day we'll meet. He nods, winds up the throttle, and is gone. 200
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE PATIENT REACHES OUT AND PUSHES TWO MORE TOWARDS HER
THEIR EYES MEET, THEN HE SHOVELS ANOTHER, THEN ALL OF THEM

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana comes in carrying FLOWERS and sets them down on the table next to a clutch of MORPHINE AMPOULES.  She picks up the hypodermic to prepare his injection.  She takes a phial.  THE PATIENT REACHES OUT AND PUSHES TWO MORE TOWARDS HER.   THEIR EYES MEET, THEN HE SHOVELS ANOTHER, THEN ALL OF THEM.  She looks at him.  IT'S A MASSIVE, LETHAL DOSE. Hana starts to prepare the injection, her eyes filling with tears.  The Patient nods, smiles, whispers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.  Thank you. She kisses him, gently on the mouth.  He closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Read to me, will you?  Read me to sleep. 201*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .(NEAR THE) BASECAMP. CAVE OF SWIMMERS. 1942. DAY. The familiar cleft in the rocks.  A PLANE is coming in to land. 202
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    TORCHLIGHT. A flashlight flickers in the cave.  ALMASY APPEARS. KATHARINE'S CORPSE lies where he left her - a ghost on a bed of silk and blankets.  The chill of the cave has preserved her.  She could be asleep.  She clutches the Herodotus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Katharine, my darling. He sobs, whispering to her.  He's terribly cold, exhausted.  He slips underneath the covers to be next to her, and closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so tired. 203*.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: KATHARINE HAS WRITTEN IN THE MARGINS

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. The Patient is slipping away.  Hana is reading from the last pages of the Herodotus where KATHARINE HAS WRITTEN IN THE MARGINS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My darling, I'm waiting for you - how long is a day in the dark, or a week? The Patient looks across AND WHAT HE SEES IS KATHARINE BESIDE HIM IN THE BED, SMILING, STROKING HIS HEAD, SPEAKING TO HIM. 204
direction.name: direction

result.heading: KATHARINE BESIDE HIM IN THE BED, SMILING, STROKING HIS HEAD, SPEAKING TO HIM

direction.raw_text: .    FLASHLIGHT. Katharine is writing.  The FLASHLIGHT is faint.  She shivers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the fire is gone now, and I'm horribly cold.  I really ought to drag myself outside but then there would be the sun... She passes the flashlight across the wall, the painted figures dancing in the pale light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid I waste the light on the paintings and on writing these words... 205
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BED IS EMPTY, THE MATTRESS STRIPPED

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. THE BED IS EMPTY, THE MATTRESS STRIPPED.  Hana stands in the doorway, then sees THE HERODOTUS on the bedside table. She picks it up, goes to the page of Katharine's letter, continues to read.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We die, we die rich with lovers and tribes, tastes we have swallowed... 206*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Caravaggio is at the gate to the Monastery.  The TRUCK we saw before is waiting with him.  The PARTISAN with his head bandana and shotgun remains the same, but now there are CHILDREN in the back and a WOMAN sits behind the man, nursing a two-year-old.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hana!  Come on! He gets up into the BALUSTRADE, tentatively finds his balance, then starts to walk, heel to toe - slowly, and then with more confidence - along the long thin line of stone.  The children watch intently.  He turns and bows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...bodies we have entered and swum up like rivers, fears we have hidden in like this wretched cave... 207*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Hana walks across the cloisters, passing the chalked hopscotch squares, leaving it all behind.  Then she stops, bends, retrieves A SNAIL SHELL, keeps going.  KATHARINE'S VOICE CONTINUES. 208
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SMUDGES KATHARINE'S PALE FACE WITH COLOR

direction.raw_text: .    TORCHLIGHT. ALMASY SMUDGES KATHARINE'S PALE FACE WITH COLOR.  OCHRE across her brow, BLUE on her eyelids, RED on her lips.  He presses his cheek to hers, smoothes her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I want all this marked on my body. We are the real countries, not the boundaries drawn on maps with the names of powerful men... 209*.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. KATHARINE'S VOICE CONTINUES.  Hana comes out to the truck, carrying her small bundle.  Caravaggio effects some introduction, beginning with the woman driver, Gioia.  She and Caravaggio smile like lovers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hana - this is Gioia. Gioia smiles, shakes her hand.  Then Hana meets the others - Gioia's brother and wife, their children.   She smiles at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buon' giorno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She can take you as far as Florence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can get in the back. And she clambers up, sits down between the children.  They exchange some small stiff, shy smiles, and then the truck bounces away.  Hana takes one final look at the Monastery as it disappears around the bend and then turns and confronts the life insisting noisily in the truck. 210
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. Almasy comes out of the cave, carrying the bundle of Katharine in his arms, wrapped in the silks of her parachute.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I know you will come and carry me out into the palace of winds, the rumors of water... That's all I've wanted - to walk in such a place with you, with friends, on earth without maps. 211
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .    DAY. THE PLANE growls and complains into the air. 212
direction.name: direction
